titleStmt.title: Indien 309. வள்ளியம்மைபுறாணசாரம் Vaḷḷiyammaipuṟāṇacāram (text and commentary/summary, interspersed, of Vaḷḷiyammaipuṟāṇam)

repository.orgName: Bibliothèque nationale de France. Département des Manuscrits

extent.note: The edges of f108‒f113 and f202‒f213 are rounded.

supportDesc.condition: Fairly good state of preservation, considering the age of the manuscript and in spite of bore holes caused by insects. Some folios are truncated.

acquisition.p: Bequest of Edouard Ariel. Made first to Société Asiatique de Paris in 1855, later transfered to Bibliothèque Nationale (see Rosny 1869).

body.p: The Vaḷḷiyammaipurāṇam is a narrative telling the legend of Vaḷḷi, the consort of Murukaṉ. It appears to be an epitome of the Kantapurāṇam (Taylor 1845, p. 61).

Other manuscript testimonies of this text are: Bnf Indien 310; GOML D. 629 (see Rangacharya & Kuppusvami Sastri 1916, p. 630); Mackenzie MSS n° 121 C. M. 42 and n° 122 C. M. 46 (see Taylor 1845, p. 57). As GOML D. 629 is also a Mackenzie MS, it might be identical with Mackenzie MS n° 122 C. M. 46.
The palm-leaf bundle, a single-text manuscript, contains, on the front woodcover:
U1: 1 folio, unfoliated = title-page, by hand n° 1. With shelfmark: "11" and "B/53".
It contains, between the two woodcovers:

U2: 248 folios, Tamil foliation 1‒288 (f31, f63, f63, f65, f210‒f246 missing; f68‒f69 refoliated 67‒68; 2 folios foliated 69) = text (mūlam), 5 to 6 lines per page, by several hands (see fr288, rm), different from hand n° 1.
The text is incomplete. See above, description of U2 and mention of missing folios.
Paratexts: marginal and in-text benedictions; title-page; marginal chapter headers; in-text chapter completion statement; colophon.

U1, folio 1, recto, unfoliated = title-page: title.
(f[1]r1‒2) vaḷḷiyammaipurāṇam

Front woodcover = title (part 1 of 2)
{piḷḷaiyār cuḻi} vaḷḷiyāmma-

To be read with Back woodcover, which is inscribed:
ṉ pūrāṇam
The front woodcover is further inscribed "pu ta" (in smaller letters), that is, "puttakam" (?).

U2, folio 1, recto and verso and folio 2, recto = incipit: benediction and title in left margin; invocations (6 stanzas under chapter header Tōttiram; the phrase "koṇṭalait tikaḻ" at the beginning of stanza n° 1 is borrowed, it seems, from Tēvāram 2.38.3 stanza n° 4 being the Kāppu of the Kantapurāṇam) and benedictions; incipit proper.
(f1r1) koṇṭalait tikaḻ vāri-k kuṇā(l) mēl ‡ moṇṭalai-t teṟimuttaiyaḷ-t timāra ‡ taṇṭalai-p payira n(o/ō)caratai-p pati ‡ maṇṭala-p pi
(f1r2) ḷḷaiyārai vaṇaṅku-v ām {pcs} viṉāyakara [i.e. vināyakar] tōttiram {pcs} (...)
(...)
(f1v6) Āṟu-mā-mukamum vāḻ vē-
(f2r1) tti-vēl [i.e. veṟṟi-vēl] vāḻi vāḻi {pcs} tōttiramuṟṟum {pcs} cīvakaṉ kēḻvi (...)

U2, folio 288, verso = colophon: benedictions, scribal colophon.
(f288r5) ḷ eṉṟav āṟu {pcs} {pcl}. Ākaiyiṉālē yinta vaḷḷiyammaipuṟāṇattai paṭitta pērum keṭṭa pērum Immai-
(f288r6) yilē niṉaitta kāriyamum cittiyām maṟumaiyilē moṣṣamumm [i.e. mokṣamum] uṇṭām – kāṟttikai naṣṣattiram kantar
(f288v1) caṣṭi cevvāykkiḻamai cōmavāram itukaḷilē Oru poḻutiruntu mu-k-kāla-k kēṭṭa pērum mu-k-kāla-
(f288v2) p paṭitta pērum eḻutiṉa pērum – Ivarkaḷukk’ ellām kantacupāmi [i.e. kantacuvāmi] tuṇai-y iruppār tirucciṟṟampalam {pcl}.
(f288v3) naḷa varuṣam kāṟttikai {mācam} 27 {tēti} kuruvāṟa-ṉāḷ-k kālamē
(f288v4) Uttiraṭṭāti-naṣcattirattil śrīmucē parititu vācimutt(i)ya-p-piḷḷaikaḷ Ava-
(f288v5) rkaḷ vaḷḷiyammaipuṟāṇattai kaṉṉiyappaṉ Eḻuti muṭintatu muṟṟum {pcl}
(f288v, rm) palapēruṭaiya kai-y eḻuttu

Abbreviations. c = column, f = folio, lm = left margin, r = recto, rm = right margin, U = unit (codicological and/or textual), v = verso. GOML = Government Oriental Manuscripts Library, Madras/Chennai. MTL = Madras Tamil Lexicon. TMSSML = Tanjore Maharaja Serfoji Sarasvati Mahal Library.

Unmarked puḷḷi, ō, and ē restored. Conjectural (whether the text is not clearly legible or the character is ambigous, e.g. kāl or length of o and e) readings between parentheses. Alternative readings between parentheses separated by slash. Lost or entirely illegible character: "?". Crossed-out character: "X". Conjectural restoration of lost or entirely illegible between square brackets. Uppercase for initial vowels (in excerpts only). Unquoted text represented by (...). Conjunct letter: e.g. t°, to be read tum or tam. Grantha letters in bold. Symbols/Abbreviations made explicit, between curly brackets: {pcs} = piḷḷaiyār cuḻi, short form; {pcl} = piḷḷaiyār cuḻi, long form, that is, with long horizontal stroke towards right; {varuṣam}, {mācam}, {tēti}; {line-filler}. Unfoliated folio number between square brackets, e.g. "f[1]r". Numerals normalised to decimal notation, e.g. "1121" not "1000 1 100 2 10 1". Hyphen occasionaly used to mark in-word components. Hyphen systematically used at the end of a line when the line-beginning is within a word or within a cīr. Sandhi split to the minimum: overshort u occasionally restored as an apostrophe. Stanzas split by cīr, as far as possible. aṭi boundary marked by "‡".
